name: Enable PCI Passthrough
description: Enables PCI passthrough (IOMMU) on Proxmox VE host by configuring GRUB bootloader and required kernel modules. Supports both Intel (intel_iommu=on) and AMD (amd_iommu=on) processors.

notes.text: ⚠️ Please run the command below **only** in the Proxmox VE Shell. This script is intended for managing or enhancing the host system directly.

A reboot is REQUIRED after running this script for changes to take effect. This script modifies GRUB bootloader configuration and kernel modules. Backups are created automatically. Required kernel modules (vfio, vfio_iommu_type1, vfio_pci, vfio_virqfd) are automatically configured.

The script automatically detects your CPU type (Intel or AMD) and applies the correct IOMMU parameter. After reboot, verify IOMMU is enabled with: dmesg | grep -e DMAR -e IOMMU. View IOMMU groups with: find /sys/kernel/iommu_groups/ -type l.
For Intel CPUs: Adds 'intel_iommu=on' to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT. For AMD CPUs: Adds 'amd_iommu=on' to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
